history.content:
As far as I know, postponing EGT is nontrivial. Usually, it is reserved for people who are TA'ing over the summer. Also, you cannot backdate a course from spring if summer is your last semester as an undergrad, so that strictly works against your favor if you are taking a class right now that you want to backdate. 

I am a current 5th year masters student and I took a class over summer as a visiting grad student. It is a bit more expensive than undergraduate summer classes, unfortunately, but the class I took was a prereq for 2 classes that I took in Fall/am taking this Spring, so I thought it was worth it. 

In regards to having a "tidy" transcript, you will have two transcripts anyway: undergrad and grad. My summer class is part of my grad transcript. I am pretty sure you cannot use your summer class as part of your 5th year requirements, but extra classes you take that aren't part of requirements show up on your transcript regardless.

children.subject: To add onto that, when asking about TAing over the summer between last semester undergrad and fifth year masters, I was told that was only allowed for summer instructors, for who exceptions could be made, not summer TAs.
No, you officially become a masters student in fall, so it doesn't count.
If courses are taken as a visiting grad student during Summer 2021, would the courses satisfy graduation requirements for the 5th years masters?

history.content:
Hello,

I was wondering if I can take summer courses right before 5th year master.

If so, can we change our EGT (expected graduation term) to Summer 2021 and take summer courses? Or should I take the courses as a visiting graduate student? I thought it would be better to postpone EGT since the course record in a single transcript would be tidier.

Thank you!
history.subject: Summer Courses right before 5th year master?
